## Installation
Use the following command from inside `R`:
```{r install, echo = TRUE, eval = FALSE}
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("JonasMoss/semselector")
```

## Usage
Call the `library` function, prepare data into matrix form, and run the 
`semselector` function. 

```{r prepare, echo = TRUE, eval = TRUE}
library("semselector")
model <- "A =~ A1+A2+A3+A4+A5;
          C =~ C1+C2+C3+C4+C5"
n <- 200
object <- lavaan::sem(model, psych::bfi[1:n, 1:10])
pvalues(object)
        
```

You can calculate the distribution of *p*-values using the following command:
``` {r plot_echo, echo = TRUE, eval = FALSE}
library("semselector")
set.seed(313)
boots <- bootstrapper(object, n_reps = 5000)

library("ggplot2")
theme_set(theme_minimal())
ggplot(reshape2::melt(as.data.frame(t(boots))), aes(value)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  xlab("p-value") +
  facet_wrap(~variable, nrow = 3)
```

``` {r plot_eval, echo = FALSE, eval = TRUE}
library("ggplot2")
theme_set(theme_minimal())
ggplot(reshape2::melt(as.data.frame(t(boots))), aes(value)) +
  geom_histogram() +
  xlab("p-value") +
  facet_wrap(~variable, nrow = 3)
```
